One of the best games ever made. Enough said.

Recommended to those who enjoy linear, narrative-driven shooters.  Although the game is well over a decade old, I found the experience to still be enjoyable as of this writing.  Many modern day staples are derivative from Valve's work and indeed, the sequel to one of gaming's finest still holds up many years down the line.  However, if you played the original and for some reason have not played this yet, you may be left disappointed.  Half-Life 2 is more of a 'daring-do' escapade where Freeman is lauded as somewhat of a mythical savior by humanity's remaining survivors of an alien invasion.  Gone is the feeling of unforgiving isolation and one man's personal, unsung struggle to simply stay alive as everything falls apart around him.  While the sequel conjures these feelings every once in a while, I found them to have much less impact than the original (the current year notwithstanding).  Although newly introduced gameplay elements make up for this in part, the experience goes in a considerably different direction than the first.  Regardless, the product is extremely polished and the gameplay will be satisfying if this type of game is up your alley.  If not, you may want to make an exception for this one given its pedigree.  To those who played the original - you will most likely enjoy this but don't expect the same burlap sack of magic from 1998.  If you don't enjoy FPS's, well then why are you reading this review?

Half life 2 'ye puan vermek gerekirse :

95/100

Good but not THAT good.
This game is kinda overrated, now overrated doesn't mean bad, it just means that the game isn't as good as some people make it out to be. The story is pretty good if a bit cliche. The actual shooting of the game however isn't the best, it doesn't feel satisfying and can get a bit repetitive after some time playing it. As well as this the characters don't feel fully fleshed out, they all have there own personalities yes, but why should I care for them? I don't know a thing about them. One thing that is a very personal complaint is that Gordon throughout the game is treated as this saint that is praised and followed, but he is a silent protagonist, I thought that the whole point of that would be to project the personality of the character you want onto them, like in the first game where you can just kill literally every friendly NPC, that made the first much better but that is just my opinion.

7/10
Amazing, Astonishing I can't wait for the third to come out soon.

After a long time, I realised that I never played Half Life, despite of having heard it a thousand times. So I started with Half Life 1. Because it is an old game, I tried to expect nothing big. There are a handful of games that really can stand the test of time. Boy, did Half Life stand it. After finishing it, I started with Half Life 2. I cannot imagine how players felt 15 YEARS AGO. In the meantime, whole lot of game companies have made profit from games, but never could match the experience. There are some that came close. Every game developer should study the classics, like this one.

I probrably shouldn't review HL2 because it has been done a million times already. We know its great. Ravenholm Sucks Though. Ravenholm is honestly my least favorite level in any video game including having the courage to beat Tick-Tock Clock from Mario 64 8 times. I would rather play "Megamind The Blue Defender" on Nintendo DS forever than play Ravenholm once.
